pullRequest.bodyText:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ISPN-11700
This PR also has the side-effect of enabling non-interactive invocation of commands:
cli.sh user create -p password tristan

nodes.bodyText: all these changes just to fix the native compilation? :(

can you fix the algorithm in this PR?
if you mix clear and encrypted passwords you can't login with some users:
[disconnected]> user create test -p test
[disconnected]> user create unsecure -p weak --plain-text 
[disconnected]> connect -u test -p test
The supplied credentials are invalid 
[null]> connect -u unsecure -p weak                # where the "null" comes from!?
[pedro-laptop-3-17779@cluster//containers/default]> 

may I suggest to have the "algorithm" per user? like <user>:<type>:<password> where type can be 0 (==clear) or 1 (==encrypted)
Probably work for another PR...
can we have autocompletion?

this may be a stupid question, but... are all the "default" algorithms supported?
[disconnected]> user create test2 -a scram-sha-1 -p test2
[disconnected]> connect -u test2 -p test2
The supplied credentials are invalid

wdyt of splitting this subcommand in 2?

one for change password (set new password, encrypt with new algorithm)
another one for groups (add or remove groups)
can it fail if password and groups are null? (so, no change)

./bin/cli.sh -c - -u <user> -p <pass> [-f commands.cli]

commit.message:
ISPN-11700 User tool inside CLI

* convert the CLI launcher to be a command. This enables non-interactive mode
* add a deprecation message in the user-tool.[sh|bat] scripts
